description: The US has halted EB-1 green card issuances until October 1, 2025, after reaching the annual cap for fiscal year 2025. This follows a similar freeze in the EB-2 category. Indian applicants face continued delays, with the EB-1 final action date stuck at February 15, 2022. No EB-1 or EB-2 approvals will be made until the new fiscal year begins. Adjustment of status applications may still be filed if priority dates remain current.

Constable killed, another injured as car runs over them in Worli during patrolling
GST overhaul: Govt permits revised MRPs on unsold stock; old packaging allowed till Dec
description: The government has granted packaged goods manufacturers permission to print revised MRPs on unsold stock following the new GST rules, allowing them to use existing packaging until December. This decision addresses industry concerns about potential waste of packaging material worth over Rs 2,000 crore.

Allu Arjun’s Business Park flagged for illegal construction; GHMC issues notice
description: Icon Star Allu Arjun's family faces legal trouble as the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) issued a notice regarding illegal construction at Allu Business Park in Jubilee Hills. The GHMC alleges unauthorized extensions on the fourth floor, violating the sanctioned plan. Deputy Commissioner Sammaiah has ordered an inquiry into the matter.

title: Watch: PM Modi conducts aerial survey in flood-hit Himachal; to visit Punjab next
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi surveyed flood-ravaged areas in Himachal Pradesh, including Mandi and Kullu, following heavy monsoon rains. He then proceeded to Punjab for a similar assessment. Review meetings were held with officials and affected residents in both states, addressing the devastation and coordinating relief efforts. The floods have caused significant fatalities and displacement in both regions.

title: Stray dogs ‘killed, charred to death’ in Northwest Delhi; police say probing complaints
Sparks already flying! Why India and Pak skippers weren't seated together at Asia Cup presser
description: In Dubai, organisers strategically placed Afghanistan's Rashid Khan between India's Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha at the Asia Cup 2025 press conference. Yadav emphasized the importance of aggression for victory, while Agha left emotional regulation to his players. India, aiming for their ninth title, will face Pakistan on September 14.

description: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has given his fast bowlers the green light to be aggressive during the Asia Cup, emphasizing that aggression is inherent to their game. He stressed the importance of playing good cricket and aiming to win the tournament. Agha acknowledged India's strong Asia Cup record but believes any team can win in T20 cricket.

title: Delhi CM Secretariat, Maulana Azad Medical College get bomb threat
description: A bomb threat email targeted Delhi's Chief Minister's Secretariat and Maulana Azad Medical College, prompting immediate responses. Fire tenders and bomb disposal squads were dispatched to both locations for thorough anti-sabotage checks. Authorities are investigating the email's origin, suspecting it may have been misdirected, but are treating the threat with utmost seriousness, ensuring public safety and security.

title: Why Australia fined a Kerala actress Rs 1 lakh for carrying jasmine into the country
Asia Cup: Surya warns Pakistan; drops hints of aggression on September 14
description: Suryakumar Yadav, India's captain, has issued a confident warning to Pakistan ahead of their Asia Cup clash, emphasizing the team's inherent aggression on the field. He acknowledged the long gap since India's last T20I but expressed confidence in the team's preparation and adaptability.

Nepal protest: Manisha Koirala breaks her silence; calls it a ‘Black Day'
description: Bollywood actress Manisha Koirala has expressed her heartbreak over the violent protests erupting in Nepal after the government banned several social media platforms. Koirala, a native of Kathmandu, called it a 'black day' as security forces responded with gunfire to demonstrations against the ban on platforms like Facebook and YouTube.

title: Grandfather Bandu Andekar among 6 more arrested for ‘revenge’ murder of Pune youth Ayush Komkar
Kia India passes full GST benefit: Model-wise savings up to Rs 4.48 lakh
description: Kia India will extend the full benefit of the recent GST reduction to customers on its ICE portfolio, effective September 22, 2025. The price cuts vary by model, with the Sonet seeing a reduction of up to Rs 1.64 lakh and the Carnival getting the biggest slash of Rs 4.48 lakh.

description: Protests in Nepal escalated, resulting in vandalism at the residences of President Poudel and KP Sharma Oli, alongside the torching of the Nepali Congress party office. Demonstrators are demanding accountability for fatalities during protests against the government's social media ban, which has now been reversed.

title: Dhanashree Verma gives out a strong message for women post divorce with Yuzvendra Chahal
description: Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal finalized their divorce earlier this year, aiming for a swift resolution before the IPL season. Dhanashree, now part of 'Rise And Fall,' shared her message of resilience for women post-divorce, emphasizing the importance of continuing to work hard and inspiring others to move forward with strength.

Rs 14k–16k cr scheme in works to cut construction gear import reliance
description: The Indian government is planning a Rs 14,000-16,000 crore scheme to boost domestic manufacturing of essential construction equipment. This initiative aims to reduce India's dependence on imports, particularly from China, Japan, South Korea, and Germany, and strengthen the infrastructure supply chain.

title: Blow for Indian IT? Trump admin’s HIRE Act sends jitters; tax on overseas jobs likely
description: A proposed US bill, the HIRE Act, threatens Indian IT firms with a 25% tax on outsourced services, potentially eroding their competitive edge. This legislative move, coupled with existing market pressures, could force Indian companies to seek growth beyond the US and impact new contract acquisitions. The bill raises concerns about increased costs and reduced demand for IT services.

title: Boney Kapoor paid Rs 3.5 cr for rights of South film but didn’t make a remake, shot Pukar twice: ‘The film didn’t make money for me’

description: Tech mogul Elon Musk's recent philosophical post on the nature of reality has sparked widespread interest. His ventures like SpaceX and Neuralink, pushing the boundaries of human existence, frame his inquiry. Musk's reflection came amidst progress in Mars landing simulations and his growing political influence.

Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
description: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: Chaos in Nepal: MEA issues advisory; helpline numbers released - key points
JJ McCarthy’s girlfriend Katya Kuropas: Vikings QB’s longtime love, now fiancée - who is she?
description: Minnesota Vikings' rookie J.J. McCarthy is set for his NFL debut against the Chicago Bears, marking a pivotal moment for the franchise and the player. Off the field, McCarthy's personal life is flourishing. He is engaged to his high school sweetheart, Katya Kuropas, and they are expecting their first child in September.

title: 'The Conjuring: Last Rites’: Loud narration during screening sparks fight; techie, his wife thrashed
description: A Chinchwad multiplex screening of 'The Conjuring: Last Rites' turned violent when a techie's request for a man to stop narrating the movie escalated into a physical altercation. The techie and his wife were allegedly attacked by the man and his wife after the techie politely asked them to stop spoiling the movie.

title: Maratha quota row: Jarange warns of blocking Mumbai milk supply; Dasara plans announced
description: Manoj Jarange, a quota activist, returned to his village after a hunger strike, warning the government to meet Maratha reservation demands by September 17. He threatened to halt milk and vegetable supplies to Mumbai if the government fails to distribute Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas in Marathwada based on the Hyderabad Gazette.

title: Bow wow! Stray dogs corner bike thieves, cops swoop in; 40 stolen motorcycles recovered
description: A gang of vehicle thieves, responsible for stealing over 40 motorcycles in Lucknow, were apprehended thanks to an unexpected intervention. During a police chase near Kudiya Ghat, a pack of stray dogs blocked the criminals' escape route, forcing them into a dead end where police were waiting.

title: iPhone 17 launch event today: How, when and where to watch; expected devices
description: Apple's "Awe Dropping" event on September 9, 2025, is set to unveil the iPhone 17 series, including the rumored iPhone 17 Air, replacing the Plus model. Anticipate upgrades to the Apple Watch, potentially introducing the Ultra 3 with enhanced features, and a redesigned AirPods Pro 3 with a new H3 chip.
